p: PEDv primarily enters pigs’ bodies through the fecal-oral route, although airborne transmission may play a role (Alonso et al. 2014). Diarrhea and vomiting result in the spread of PEDv through contaminated environmental sources including pigs, trailers, clothing (Lowe et al. 2014), sow’s milk (Sun et al. 2012), feed, and feed-supplements such as spray-dried porcine plasma (Pasick et al. 2014), highlighting the importance of biosecurity.
